stem: Determine the clinical manifestation based on the pathophysiology of end-stage liver disease.
template: The client with cirrhosis who has a flapping tremor of the hands when extended is experiencing {{sign1}}, while the buildup of fluid in the peritoneal cavity is called {{sign2}}.

rationale.correct: Asterixis (liver flap) is a sign of hepatic encephalopathy due to high ammonia. Ascites is caused by portal hypertension and low albumin.
rationale.incorrect: Spider angiomas are skin changes. Esophageal varices are enlarged veins prone to bleeding. Both are cirrhosis signs but not the flapping tremor.
clinicalPearls: Lactulose is given to reduce ammonia and treat asterixis.
